text: having read law at university i always
thought i'd be a lawyer advocating in
the courts
never would i've imagined i'd be
advocating for customers and how they
can use cloud technology to achieve
their business goals
as someone that thrives on challenges
and making a difference i was searching
for an organisation that i could really
grow and develop within
and i was seeking a role where i had the
opportunity to make a real
impactful difference and develop new
skills as a leader
today i am an aws enterprise account
executive
working with retailers who want to
provide the best services for their
customers end-to-end
it was apparent after joining the
technology industry almost 20 years ago
that there were not many people in
senior positions that looked like me
or came from my background because of
this when i joined aws
i volunteered as an inclusion ambassador
and i also took a leading role in the
women at aws network in the uk
which is a subset of the women at amazon
affinity group
inclusion diversity and equity is
important to aws
because it brings together individuals
groups and communities
idne creates a culture where unique
perspectives
experiences and opinions are valued
respected and can be authentically
expressed
as a leader at aws it is important to
not only see representation at every
level
that is reflective of the global
community we serve but to support and
encourage employee career paths that
recognise
aspiring talent and the diversity that
leadership requires
it's very easy to say that i enjoy the
work that i do but it's made a lot
easier with a supportive team
great colleagues and friends made along
the way
